Humans

From Achron Wiki
(Redirected from Human)
Jump to: navigation, search

The Humans are one of the three playable species in Achron. All of the human playable units were originally deployed by CESO to defend the Remnant System. Humans have an additional resource, Reserves, which is used to build units alongside L-Crystals and Q-Plasma. They build units in two tech tiers. Marines build basic level and Mechs build heavy grade structures.

Units

Icon Role Name Build Special Inflict Recover Description Built by Cost Requirement
Marine
Cheap construction unit. Strong against air. Can ride on a Tank Armory 8 1 None
Special Op
Heals infantry. Resolves status conditions. Can ride on a Tank. Can see cloaked units Armory 14 1 None
Mech
Advanced construction unit Factory 40 None
ATHC
Scout unit. Can see cloaked units Factory 37 16 1 None
Lancer
Basic flying scout unit. Can break TSS Factory 18 36 1 None
Tornade
Large flying unit. Can see cloaked units. Factory 65 75 1 Machinery
Tank
Medium ground unit. Can carry 2 Infantry Factory 75 40 1 Machinery
Heavy Tank
Heavy ground unit. Can carry 2 Infantry. Can infect Nanites. Tank (Upgrade) 21 20 + 1 Tank Ground Units
MFB
Heavy Support unit. Can repair other units and resolve status conditions Macrofab 71 56 1 Machinery
Blackbird
Flying repair unit. Can cloak temporarily Macrofab 65 80 1 Machinery
MAR Tank
Tank killer unit. Can merge with another MAR tank to make a Twin MAR Macrofab 41 24 1 None
Twin MAR
Artillery unit. Can carry 2 infantry MAR Tank (Merge) 2 MAR Tanks Ground Units
Frigate
Quick flying unit Macrofab 86 44 1 None
Heavy Cruiser
Large flying assault unit. Can load and drop Nukes Macrofab 113 88 1 Machinery
Carrier
Massive troop transport. Can carry up to 60 squares worth of units. Can carry Resource boxes Mech 218 146 Aerospace
Nocturne (Achron)
Assassin mode target. Cannot attack or chronoport

It should be noted that all units are fighters. Some are better than others, but no unit is incapable of fighting.

Buildings

Icon Name Use Built by Cost Requirement
Armory Builds Marines and Special Ops, Researches all tech. Marine
Mech 		50
75 		None
Resource Processor Harvests L-Crystal and Q-Plasma. Can move Marine 80 None
Importer Generates and stores Reserves Marine
Mech 		50
90 		None
Factory Builds Mechs, Lancers, ATHCs, Tanks, and Tornades Marine 70 None
Comm Center Enables Smart Idle and automatic hierarchy creation. Can move and fly, but can only activate on ground. Has a notably large vision radius. Marine 28 20 None
Macrofab Builds MFBs, Blackbirds, MAR Tanks, Frigates, and Heavy Cruisers. Loads Nukes onto Heavy Cruisers Mech 80 60 None
Defence Turret Attacks nearby enemy units and buildings. Removes TSS. Can see cloaked units. Can upgrade own weapon. Mech 95 28 Machinery
Slingshot Automatically teleports units within its radius to a set location. Can move. Mech 21 5 Gate Tech
Teleporter Allows units within its teleport radius to teleport. Mech 38 85 Gate Tech
Chronoporter Gate Allows units within it's chronoport radius to chronoport. Can also place a TSS on units. Mech 50 25 Gate Tech

Upgrades

Icon Name Description Cost Requirement
Machinery Unlocks most units and defense turrets. Allows Aerospace Research 50 40 None
Ground Units Unlocks Heavy Tank upgrade and Allows MAR Tanks to merge. 60 40 None
Specials Unlocks special abilities (except Healing and Recovery) for all units. 120 90 None
Gate Tech Unlocks teleporters and chronoporters 297 257 None
Aerospace Unlocks Carrier and allows Heavy Cruisers to load Nukes. 200 160 Machinery

All CESO upgrades are built at the Armory.

Human Strategy

Pictured are unit movement after 5 seconds towards a common distant goal.
